abstract: Obama administration report shows Egypt is falling away from democracy, quashing freedom of expression and failing to hold its own security forces accountable for unlawful killings; concludes, however, that Egypt remains too important to national security to end $1.5 billion in aid sent there yearly; report highlights fraught history of United States' shifting views toward rapidly changing Egypt and tense contemporary relationship to it.
lead_paragraph: Egypt is moving away from democracy, stifling freedom of expression and failing to hold the security forces accountable for “arbitrary or unlawful killings,” the administration said.

headline.main: Obama Administration Criticizes Egypt in Report to Congress
headline.print_headline: Administration Criticizes Egypt in Report to Congress

snippet: Egypt is moving away from democracy, stifling freedom of expression and failing to hold the security forces accountable for “arbitrary or unlawful killings,” the administration said.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
